c5a56a0569c4f6a9.text: My name is Detective Samuel clay, and it looks like you are to be my partner of sorts on this mission.

1fa63a5c40fc7f2b.text: And in theory, you should be able to talk directly to me through your device.

240d2ed1f724526a.text: Exactly. Good to know the system works.

d2112061e7f8c989.text: And you. Good to know that the system works.

a6d50a458c55f944.text: Well, now that that's all out of the way...${outputSpeed = 250; loopDelay = 5000;}

54e754c902d5be1f.text: Now, before I get into the details, I should probably give you some background.

50f6f7976b51883f.text: Five days ago, my office received an anonymous tip that a very well-known scientist has gone missing from his home village.

5383928102e4c731.text: His name? Professor Victor Sterling.

c423a670e625a182.text: I wouldn't be surprised if you recognize the name; He's made quite an impression on the scientific community.

d03f1d2e35afafae.text: His primary area of research is chemistry, although he has dabbled in quantum physics a bit.

6302a83cf9491dfa.text: He lives in a very small town called Silverborough.

0467b4249304f3ba.text: I'm actually on my way there as we speak.

432619c5aa18d32f.text: Well, I thought I might investigate this myself.

7a1454dc10dd291f.text: I feel like the Silverborough Police haven't paid much mind to the case.

d2779c92f2f69a4c.text: Something about this case just seems off.

73526f4337bd1073.text: Shouldn't you leave this to the local authorities?

a0c541c46017bf9a.text: However, something about this case just seems off.

547336320d9ccb1e.text: Well, it's sort of difficult to explain.

709aab2db70b92fc.text: Well, it's sort of difficult to explain.

afda870a357687a4.text: I suppose you could call it a gut feeling, of sorts.

8a8efcc69db18cad.text: Since Silverborough is so out-of-the-way, the taxicab I'm riding won't be able to take me all the way there.

ed10515c6e5221e6.text: That means I'm going to have to go some of the way on foot.

1e0af1685f6ed85d.text: Thank you so much for your assistance.

80b596e8a5123b3e.text: This is where I let you go, Mr. Clay.

f96b3409a935a23b.text: No worries! Don't forget to get your bag out of the rear.

5b54115e18682028.text: Well that wasn't as difficult as I thought it might be.${outputSpeed = 500;}

f7726ecce7496091.text: In essence, that means you'll be advising me on all of my decisions, as well as monitoring me and my interactions with others.

fd0c7cdef8064a78.text: I'll be communicating to you through this long-range audio transmission device, or "earpiece," as the men back at the lab called it.

96174dd6f3105127.text: According to my files, your name is ${return playerName}, right?

e094e0a4a3d03d24.text: There's really not much to it.

049417da0a0db82a.text: I was just speaking with the cab driver.

1d18d2bd2ef561cf.text: I'm surprised you were even able to hear our conversation.

e6b69241558ca87b.text: I'm sure that'll come in handy later.

e05a29d9b00bc9bd.text: Anyway, I can see the town, but there's a problem.

9666a2f6cf093631.text: There's a pond between us. Luckily, there happens a rowboat on the close side.

4ed0cd688db8723e.text: It really is just a small, quaint town.

e452b34a2135c2ec.text: Well, like I said, there's really not that much to it.

13e4e5172dd2d2d8.text: There are some single-story houses, a town hall, a couple of restaurants...

37df4e9c40c79b9a.text: And, of course, the police station.

741b41ffd9cef5ba.text: Which is where I should be headed right now, as a matter of fact.

32fa3dc8d680a792.text: Are you going to go in?

7864127cf670814a.text: It looks to be about a five-minute walk, so...

46587122d5823c53.text: I just need to find the police station....

8099ab379c94aa16.text: Ah, there it is. It looks to be about a five-minute walk, so...

8c9d973ef5a85248.text: I'll get back to you then.

5773893d955acfe5.text: Oh, and one more thing. You don't need to leave your application open while you're waiting.

b1f34adb73ce4ca9.text: ~ The detective is walking ~${startTimer(300000)}

888543d031fa9a0c.text: Well, that didn't take too long.

1f20cfc82996c9a6.text: Did you see anything suspicious along the way?

a64353cc81c138f0.text: One thing that did stand out to me, however, was the lack of people.

07bba5cceb98d966.text: It looks like you'll be a sort of wingman for me on this case.

333bba3d41b801f1.text: Well, I was hoping to meet with the chief of police, Mr. Kane, but I don't see him.

a81ccc5d3fea13ae.text: In fact, that reminds me. On the walk here, one thing about this otherwise featureless town stood out to me:

c7038f0b6aaa7f8f.text: In fact, I don't think I saw a single person on that entire walk here.

f17bb7fca5017d68.text: I did see signs of life, like lights turning on inside of houses, lawn sprinklers starting up, and so on.

057b03f785ad2eb8.text: Do you think this is related to the investigation?

c812d142becfa69b.text: I would hardly call myself famous. That must mean that you're--${loopDelay = 2000}

e020665795f3f064.text: Pleased to meet you, Mr. Kane.

90063452289ca34a.text: Well, one thing is for sure.${loopDelay = 50}

56c8a232ffb8768e.text: Well, in any case, there's no point in waiting around.

00c840d442b6a0dc.text: Of course. Come inside, and we can get started.

828a82575ca6d2c3.text: I'm walking into the station, ${return playerName}.

32605daef8bb6925.text: You see, I'm finding that the information the suspects provided is a bit difficult to piece together myself.

4e12797f7b9c9d6f.text: Perhaps the great Detective Clay could give it a shot?

c172c6b5e7ed4ba2.text: Well, I suppose there's no harm in trying.${Puzzles[2].load()}

14c64ee2fb26077f.text: If I'm correct, it must be suspect D!

81cc026f00ed0327.text: It couldn't be suspect A, B, or C, since they would contradict each other, making more than one liar.

41def27d5d1753a0.text: If it was E, that would also create a contradiction around suspect A.

a76b91c28c563490.text: Which leaves us with suspect D as our liar.

8cb5934b94517165.text: Well, when you explain it like that, it sounds easy.

88f94395bb31eece.text: In any event, it seems you are correct.

625ddefbe560e667.text: It was hardly anything more than basic logical deduction.

ca1c1a1aabb14902.text: It seems that this was an open-and-shut case. Thank you for your help, detective.

3d490ce62aabd012.text: My men will take it from here. The criminal responsible for this will be in prison by nightfall.

df5e4f2a26417dcb.text: Well, of course! The mystery is solved, isn't it? The criminal has been identified.

b74116cb4ed772e4.text: Well, it just seems this case was rather hasty.

eeb0bced86a38720.text: Quite. After all, this town is very small.

c155e0cff421d664.text: It's very rare that something happens that requires my attention.

625e7e2e94727cce.text: Hmm. Perhaps I could conduct an investigation of my own?

6ec38120f574947f.text: After all, you wouldn't turn down the great Detective Samuel Clay, would you?

930fce22dba19c52.text: I suppose we could look around a bit, if you'd like.

b34d0a6dfc2a89d0.text: Thank you. I'd like to take a look at the late professor's home, if it isn't too much trouble.

d032382cdba2b142.text: Of course. I'll show you to his house.

af62d0f5b9237b20.text: It's somewhat secluded, up on that hill there. It'll be about a fifteen-minute walk.

023feb58bff1d7a5.text: ~ The detective is walking ~${startTimer(900000)}

067580c67b41f83b.text: I was thinking the same thing, ${return playerName}. I'll see if I can do some investigating of my own.

86f2b6d41dd08042.text: Are you sure there's nothing else you need help with?

b91293c25e9b29ed.text: Since we last spoke over the telephone, I've interviewed all five suspects.

4d443244fe796a30.text: They each provided equally believable alibis, which wasn't very helpful.

c137a7a706c0b7f8.text: However, I gave them each a chance to give me information on the other suspects.

a09a966ce2708d2e.text: I see. Did that yield any useful details?

1e55eefc2b489069.text: Oh, and by the way, when I talk to you in the presence of others, I'll be whispering, so as not to blow your cover.

2c45197929732ef0.text: Always good to have an advantage.

fae1873c6672ae8c.text: This place! It looks like it's been ransacked!

3265e4836d7d1f9b.text: Yes, it does indeed. Once we interrogate the criminal, we should have an explanation.

885bd48a86212dfa.text: I wouldn't be too sure about that...

425ab220a27cece8.text: No sir, just talking to myself.

3c69897aadeda981.text: Ah, working something out, I'm sure.

698966da4333e561.text: Anyway, it appears that the professor was kidnapped, and he sure put up a fight.

e6a74ecc660da0b6.text: Well of course. What else could it have been? There's no body, so it couldn't have been a murder.

1b1e018960439cca.text: I just wouldn't jump to a conclusion quite yet....

07a8e5a67eedd122.text: Well, I don't want to rush to a conclusion on such little evidence, but I have a theory.

e166f1e457b18eda.text: And if it's correct, I am in a world of danger.

72168e237f63688a.text: Mr. Kane, I've noticed these two parallel tracks in the carpet.

d2b7b60b2e4cdaee.text: I'll have to play my cards very carefully from now on.

029da7b7662da08e.text: They seem to be leading to the bedroom closet.

70186a367fec0d92.text: It looks as if something very heavy has been dragged along the floor.

799b4b681fabfb5b.text: Nonsense! They must be leading to that cabinet, right there at the end of them.

5bac734215e0b8b1.text: I have limited time here, and I believe Mr. Kane's patience is waning.

a1bd4df5b6f535b2.text: Leave the tracks and look elsewhere.

0c309600809c56a7.text: What do you think I should do?

aedbdbc22995e7b2.text: Follow the tracks into the closet.

015aacc4de70d7ce.text: But... I really just can't shake this feeling that the tracks are somehow significant.

51ba98084058e741.text: Call it superstition, intuition, whatever; I'm going to investigate the tracks.

687375ea884f1aea.text: Okay, I'm walking into the bedroom now.

f73a6294b0cf9b93.text: I'm walking into the bedroom now.

714070691c53082a.text: Opening the door to the closet....

78bf5a3971403a04.text: It's just another small, single-floor house.

ddec4b0ae8d0148c.text: From the outside, it looks like all of the rooms are in a row.

97354183e4bec701.text: See, it's just like I said: The cabinet was dragged along the floor.

d97ccf291e7bb0ed.text: Hmm, you did tell me that, didn't you....

a367bdc0c90879a3.text: Wait! there's a piece of paper hidden behind this dresser!

6469fc8b3d2967b1.text: What?! Well, what do you know, there is.

343bce8a7d280996.text: According to this, there's a small lab hidden somewhere within the house.

6472c103a6a08c34.text: Written here are clues as to the entrance to said lab.

48fea98075962037.text: Well, why don't you give it a crack?${Puzzles[3].load()}

e6aea47d78d652f4.text: It seems that the entrance to the secret lab would be inside the bedroom!

a264ac674d03a78b.text: Why don't we look around for a few minutes to see if we can find the entrance.

de8bb923c4ac051e.text: I've got work to attend to! I can't just stand around here all day.

35f075215d4b9359.text: You have work, do you? If you want to leave, you're more than welcome to.

61ee686c6b0bba46.text: It's just behind this bookcase. Could you help me move it?${loopDelay = 10000}

218142c82b10bc54.text: Wow! Would you look at that!

5caf31860aad48fd.text: I'll be darned. I guess you were right.

f23195ee26538677.text: There's a massive steel door embedded in the wall, but there seems to be a combination lock on it.

4a85dba9dc6ab51a.text: Well great. Now how are we supposed to get in?

a074e1bfea18b3ec.text: Hmm.... Hold on, let me see that note from the closet.

f9ebd201cb2164e2.text: Once again, there are clues. But this time, they will reveal the door's passcode.

434bd075a689af97.text: It looks to be a sort of note from the professor. It reads:

4dcf8524c7b95ca7.text: If you're reading this, that means I am probably dead.

c887723cca834d4d.text: I'm sure you have yet to find my body, and while I can't reveal too many details, I can tell you this:${outputSpeed = 80}

d06e5e2b104b7eea.text: As soon as you find my body, your mystery is as good as solved.${outputSpeed = 50}

d3f0bbb014af5922.text: Hm. Very interesting. It looks like there's some other information here too.

f37929edb5537584.text: I have a feeling that whatever stands behind this door, it will be the key to solving this mystery.${Puzzles[4].load()}

473aa1923b5c9594.text: Well then, let's give it a try.${outputSpeed=750}

5469b1f62e463925.text: The door is opening now, ${return playerName}.

a47d0d3920adade9.text: What?! It's just some tiny old room.

a7410ac3a84a981a.text: Hold on a moment. There's a lever on the wall here.

229312ba6e2ffe8c.text: Well, what are you waiting for? Pull it!

6fbebe523f0cb654.text: What on earth?! It appears this is some sort of vertical transport device.

665ba79386485184.text: Well, I guess it didn't--${loopDelay = 2000; elems.lift.play()}

39f296760a3934a7.text: I'll bet it's taking us down underground to the lab.

11f98dc7f377c566.text: Did you say something, Mr. Kane?

9480f6b4897e7463.text: Oh, I was just... er... saying that finally getting your first solid lead, it always brings a rush of excitement.

e786fec8fa86c85c.text: Keep an eye on him, detective.

142789b3f286584e.text: You're not alone in this thought, ${return playerName}.

a928bf4bafde62c6.text: Yes, there's something strange going on with him, ${return playerName}.

0b3fcc1985c65e7e.text: It's just like the old saying: Keep your friends close, but your enemies closer.

bbc30762b4052d17.text: Do you really consider him an enemy?

fe1083441dfa00f0.text: <em class="grey">Well, I wouldn't go so far as to say an enemy, but I hardly know the man.

90277eee7b7d950c.text: In these types of situations, it's good to be cautious. Especially now, in light of the warning from the professor's note.

fcb0593252955df1.text: Thank you, I will be. Anyway, I should probably get back to the investigation.

72b13f075bffdfc4.text: What? Did you say something, Clay? You must speak up.

8d833aa7d9befb9a.text: Apologies, Mr. Kane. I was just saying that we should get on with the investigation.

6782e9ade4435580.text: Indeed we should. Do me a favor and open the door behind you. It probably leads into the lab.

53cb04f55491e13f.text: Why, this has to be at least five times the size of the town itself!

7d540ddd855bb67c.text: It looks like we have our work cut out for us. Let's have a look around, and let me know if you find anything of interest.

d54f9bfa1fe53b01.text: ~ The detective is searching ~${startTimer(1500000)}

10c6484fafc1a119.text: Detective, come have a look at this.

9e0104518a5905ac.text: It looks to be a chemical recipe of some kind.

287c0fe707cada0e.text: But it doesn't look anything like a formula.

578eb788b376d542.text: No, it seems to be encoded.

defe73db739b05cc.text: Do you know what it creates?

4a6b92502ece9ad2.text: I'm no chemist, but it looks like it makes a solution and a byproduct, but I've never seen either of them in my life.

43f155d9b7f645a4.text: I'm sure these both have very interesting properties, if the professor was working on them for such a long time.

8ee841be8b84e266.text: Do you think it would be worth checking them out?

7a2f47320e6f4c83.text: I think so. It will probably provide insight into the professor's work, which could help us with our case.

e7271ff7e68391f6.text: Alright then, I'll see if I can figure it out.${Puzzles[5].load()}

12d6b545136efc8a.text: It appears that that particular combination was successful.

d1e21449569b95d5.text: I wonder what it does. Maybe pour it on that flower there?

7c65355aa224a9cd.text: Sure, let's give it a try.

ec5d0f658d72f9e0.text: I've-- never seen anything like it!

bd523dc2244196d1.text: Yes, I'm quite alright, aside from feeling a bit faint.

5705faff4050a69f.text: I just poured a few drops of this solution on a rose, and it simply vanished.

48f91144c7c7b695.text: It seems this little expedition of ours yielded some extremely valuable evidence.

a149a3f0ce24dfa5.text: I'll just take these back to the station to get them analyzed by an expert.

ca8a6ba7686c4982.text: Not so fast, Mr. Kane. I have a theory.

28de89e082300486.text: Yes. If you'll just come head back into the house-- using the stairs this time-- I'd like to try something.

d54c764a307e1982.text: ~ The detective is walking ~${startTimer(90000)}

31b5d1dc4edef99a.text: Here we are, at the professor's bedroom closet.

45c05efd5f7a1ee5.text: If you would be so kind as to hand me the serum and the antidote?

023baf5619af35a0.text: Thank you. If I just sprinkle some over the floor here... aha!

b87b8e86bcc82eb2.text: I think this clears everything up, as a matter of fact.

f085b7aafd5e1726.text: Happens to be in this very room....

2715b848ba1c23d9.text: The man who murdered the professor is none other than the professor himself!

3a7ac94ad9403c22.text: I see where you're going with this, detective.

3c26bfca78c82476.text: You will, in due time. Be patient.

193d5dad79f20f18.text: Well, I sprinkled the antidote across the floor of the professor's closet. The one with the marks in the carpet leading to it.

8a9538ac072f5cec.text: And nothing other than the body of the professor himself appeared!

e8959408e8944b2f.text: Yes, I can feel it. In fact, it feels absolutely normal, aside from being a bit warm to the touch.

43ca99a2a769e46b.text: Yes, go ahead. Take both of them.

c1329995b44280d6.text: Maybe, since the solution made it vanish, and the byproduct used the opposite ingredients, this will serve as a sort of antidote.

ab6bba432f8f8448.text: You mean to say that this was a suicide?

885c084dfaf83507.text: Or should I even call you that.

e6aa95719557bc8d.text: Give me a moment, ${return playerName}. You'll understand soon enough.

5d1b6bf397af7e74.text: Stop speaking in riddles! Make up your mind! Who was the murderer?!

d207dae9715ba7ed.text: Why, that's preposterous! I'm the chief of police! I signed an oath! I would never!

9ae1dc2735353b20.text: The murderer-- the real one-- was you, Kane.

9463af85ebb0df08.text: That's what I thought, at first. But now, I know that that is a blatant lie.

37319fcc3dadcc4a.text: You see, from the moment I arrived in this town, something seemed off.

bada84cc9e692115.text: Something about the town seemed unwelcoming, in a way.

c16b0ecb6ff67f92.text: Not to mention the fact that at first, you were trying desperately to get rid of me.

e773e14a726582f3.text: You never wanted me here in the first place.

66759bc00de421fa.text: But that all changed when you realized you could use me.

be985b6e30b8f331.text: It would've taken you ages to get down into the lab and decode the formulas on your own.

15b7ac7ecc08e762.text: If that's the case, who do you believe the murderer to be?

429202b5e0d62038.text: The body of the late professor himself appeared before us!

3b8532a666507d13.text: Had I not found that note warning me of the immense danger that I was in, I wouldn't have helped you.

226a1c2730db9296.text: It seems the professor was correct; As soon as I found his body, I did know exactly what was going on.

e48bc384b15b1b59.text: But that still doesn't explain why you don't think I'm Douglas Kane.

a9bd2758bacc9028.text: You see, you murdered the professor. And you likely would've gotten away with it, too, if it weren't for me.

ecc0a17895acf73c.text: When the real Douglas Kane summoned me, he suspected that this case would be one that would require additional support.

655b23df70f77bff.text: You killed not only the professor, but him as well, and who knows how many others. I am yet to see a single person in this town, other than you and I.

e1b690bc3548ccbf.text: And then you had the audacity to impersonate Mr. Kane. There's no way I could've known, since I've never met the man.

7e08bd60c2bcd605.text: I tried looking for a photograph inside the police station, a newspaper, anything, with Mr. Kane on it, but I couldn't find a thing.

f2572909367dbd26.text: I guess you cleaned up nicely.

e9342ea2cfe26127.text: Additionally, I never actually got to meet the five suspects for this case; I wasn't even permitted to know their names, for "security reasons."

c9ffa2e16fa1ccbe.text: But, in the most polite way I can phrase this, "Mr. Kane," I am no idiot.

229d4d10388d6634.text: You tried to lead me away from the trails you left in the carpet, when you dragged the professor's body into the closet.

623ae636d2242f2e.text: But the fibers in the carpet showed that the object had been dragged the opposite direction than what you were telling me.

004028702b13c8b1.text: Then why pretend it was a suicide?

c479661bee25b6b3.text: There's one thing I still don't understand.

45d256d8698c4c9b.text: I was just getting to that part.

3e938726b7182cc1.text: One more thing I did, just to make sure there wasn't any chance I was wrong.

4842d6a2bb2a0d14.text: Just to give you one last chance to prove your innocence.

11fd01cffb0a8ab9.text: And what would that be, Clay?

5097903d30f1c749.text: Every single time we stumbled upon something surprising in this investigation, you did a phenomenal job of acting surprised.

1a7538e99d108e0f.text: You see, when I told you I had solved the case, you got worried.

e379e11b4ce6493a.text: You figured I would turn and convict you; After all, I have yet to be wrong.

10382499f51865c4.text: But I didn't. I suggested a suicide, which genuinely surprised you.

0d2f7de3cb9d5f64.text: And let me tell you, your eyes widened more than I ever could have hoped for, proving that you'd been acting this entire time.

87ed26345eabbbe8.text: Which, in turn, proves that you knew what was going on this entire time.

09cdd13b23af83a5.text: Now, I couldn't be bothered to know who you really are, but I would like to ask you one question.

34b9e08cf027f1f0.text: The one thing that I really, truly do not understand after all this time.

78bd950877260330.text: What cause could possibly be worth the mass murder of an entire village?${outputSpeed = 500}

8ab45efd06d6ffa8.text: What do you have to say for yourself?${outputSpeed = 50}

9fd7d242c1a1d43d.text: Except that your eyes never widened.

f92e53f32fda6af3.text: None of that matters now. My getaway is finally here.

e1e2cf103839cf70.text: ${return playerName}! He's boarding a helicopter!

29a69490072967c9.text: The only people who know about this are here in this very town!

ccb04c2a4e83d5db.text: I've rigged the entire place with explosives that will be detonated in just a few short minutes!

824d475a267b571a.text: He's getting away! ${return playerName}, what should I do?

812e941972d16bb3.text: Stay here and try to defuse the bomb!

cb5fb9eac4c98d10.text: That will likely be the more difficult path. Are you sure, ${return playerName}?

967261632c7d8184.text: First, we'll have to figure out the location of the detonator.

44a56793f3578192.text: Wouldn't there have to be multiple charges?

0ca5907138e49ef5.text: Well, yes, but there would be one central detonator that activates all of those charges.

d3813a53f3766037.text: I think it would be in a central location, like town hall.

6145ad51792805cd.text: Yes, that's exactly what I was thinking. Probably town hall, actually.

f2d51854a449f55e.text: Would it be in the center of town?

008200c2274ed268.text: I guess that's where I should head next.

deeb9ffec050d6cf.text: Do you think it could be in the police station?

45b0142c74b1b912.text: But now that I'm thinking about it, that seems much more likely than the town hall.

2c4df7bf446d0ae4.text: Okay, so I got to the hall and looked around a bit.

3020172bf42194da.text: I should add that it's very small, not a lot of hiding places.

587748598adc4d55.text: After all, the man spent so much time there.

a83624a3b43d2bfe.text: Kane-- or rather, not Kane, must have spent a ton of time there.

0075e2b2a1122243.text: Where's somewhere Kane-- or rather, not Kane, is familiar with?

ccada5e0b7d221fa.text: He hasn't made it to the helicopter yet, so maybe if I sprint fast enough....

da0bfecc3961ab70.text: Alright then, I'll go after him!

d10aa066764a4de3.text: I managed to catch onto the landing gear of the helicopter as it was taking off.

7aceca07fab27f49.text: Now, we've got no time to waste. I'm going to look around and--

2843ce26d6701930.text: Let's just say I'm not going to have to do much looking around.

b61744d72ad0aac0.text: Yes, I'm fine. For now at least.

be805657b5e4e88d.text: The bomb-- or detonator, rather-- is right behind the reception desk.

fa17f4158c633eb4.text: And good heavens, it is massive.

a551755f7602da9d.text: Well, I'm going to have to defuse it, of course.

7af0735870eb5158.text: This particular model of detonator is an Obsidian 6X, if I'm remembering correctly.

d47c19710f3f4645.text: I apologize if I'm rushing you, but we've no time to waste.

e4be8253697a80ca.text: Obviously, I don't know the manual for every detonator ever created (although I do know quite a few by memory).

10f0b8a2bfbbd901.text: So, you're going to have to help me out here.

cb816f915562f82b.text: And remember: the clock is ticking.${Puzzles[6].load()}

40e203d73bd039b0.text: I sure hope so. There's no time to waste, so let's get to it.

e7e7645a98d70116.text: Phew! ${return (Puzzles[6].timer.time >= 120000) ? 'Plenty of time to spare.' : (Puzzles[6].timer.time >= 60000)  ? 'With time to spare!' : (Puzzles[6].timer.time >= 30000)  ? 'Just in the nick of time!' : 'With barely any time to spare!'}

676e6eca1c233277.text: You know, for a second there, I really thought I was done for.

c350f8230b728bb7.text: ...It's just so crazy to think that that could've been the end of me.

25d410ad78d9e088.text: Well, no matter. It's over, and I think we can finally consider this case solved.

fabc567406710e80.text: Oh? Was there something I overlooked?

c0f66e0d4f731982.text: I think that nobody lives in this town.

612bf1ee7b946f8b.text: That would explain why I never saw anybody, and why I couldn't find any newspapers or photographs.

2159f82fc074ef4c.text: But why does the town exist in the first place?

67dcd5a6e27520c9.text: Maybe everybody was evacuated after Mr. Kane was murdered.

91d1aa522d8b8bc1.text: Possibly as a cover-up for the professor and his laboratory.

fb056c2382f2cd18.text: But that wouldn't explain why lights were still turning on and off inside of houses.

f63afb189e300e5f.text: Maybe it was a way for the professor to be able to perform his studies alone, without distraction.

c33b4073f645f6fe.text: That's what I was thinking, too.

0bb67b25c0458978.text: And anyone who came to this town wouldn't see a massive lab, but just a small village hidden away in the countryside.

85eae73b309039d2.text: Anyway, on to more important matters.

fff7966713573cd5.text: Unfortunately, it looks like the fake Mr. Kane is going to get away, but I've alerted the proper authorities to keep an eye out for him.${outputSpeed = 1000}

b32b5854d23967ce.text: I just need to find a way into the cabin.

08269c70601c42f1.text: Remember that thing I just said about not being seen?

e8da84876041a1ce.text: They're flying up now, and it's getting to be very windy.

51b28f3183886b30.text: Try to get into the cabin!

109ad3833f31e937.text: I'm doing my best, but my fingers are getting colder at a rapid pace.

63029e26bc82c0fe.text: I'm going to try to see if I can get in through the door.

503cdd650c1edcfe.text: Okay, I'm going to try to see if I can get in through the door.

f1aa7bfe4c951623.text: Agh! They're trying to shake me off!

3bd15bb9ffeeb785.text: Certainly a risky move, but I'm nearly out of options at this point.${loopDelay = 50}

9358d4793e47dffc.text: They saw me And they aren't too happy about it.

0a01d0f882ece3e9.text: I don't-- I don't think I can hold on much longer, ${return playerName}!

9226f3a77e6cff57.text: Try to break through the window!

13d1b4e4b0c73537.text: Hold on just a little longer!

8b3278d34b43b4a5.text: There is one thing I didn't figure out, though.

5d144ac4f9a1139f.text: If you needed my assistance to gain access to the lab, how did you hide the professor's body?

f6025fed4e8fa6f8.text: How did you get your hands on the serum?

8c753077afc9f1c3.text: Recently, I'd overheard him speaking of an invisibility serum, but I had to see for myself.

1d496fc9b1b435a3.text: I was the professor's primary assistant.

ed7f4514656c7a3f.text: I stole a sample and confirmed his claims.

6e8e13e50df6c11c.text: When he told me he wouldn't produce it commercially, well...

f63a96af8631250d.text: You murdered him in cold blood, so you could make money off of his creation.

b575fcdc2cae1ed7.text: I've worked with some horrendous criminals in my time, but you!

cc37b1803e116a5d.text: You are a truly awful human being.

63e1c100e52c4f59.text: Have you even an ounce of remorse?${outputSpeed = 500}

6ab7839517119e95.text: Ha! You really think you can get to me?

10bc603a65d43b04.text: I'm sorry, ${return playerName}, but I really don't think I can keep this up!

d2fc42fd60a19325.text: I'm going to try to get into the cockpit!

e06b6c58de4d43ab.text: I think I'll have to enter through a window!

12fdd82168e561ec.text: The glass is very thick, and I can't break it with my shoulder!

d4837e934050bd45.text: Trust me-- make sure they see you!

df447fea886c94ed.text: No luck there. Any other id--${loopDelay = 2000}

0ef9a5bf91faac9c.text: Of course! If I use it as a precise pressure point, I just might be able to--${loopDelay = 50}

2b58a25062a37f67.text: If they see me, they'll shoot at me and-- oh, that's what you're going for, isn't it.

4a8c70e207b843ab.text: Alright, I'm trusting you here, ${loopDelay = 50; return playerName}.

46b3373581666683.text: I'm taunting them now, and it looks like--${loopDelay = 2000}

1ffb554f85ed9325.text: Right in my left shoulder; I should be fine for now, but I've only got few minutes before it becomes an issue.

ae716a72ceb02eb1.text: On the bright side, the glass is broken! I'm climbing in!

85f43b7d78426345.text: I'd like you to meet my pilot, Percival.

f64746c49e93f5c5.text: You must stop this nonsense! You are a wanted man!

782697a9f6d4cef1.text: I've already alerted the authorities of your location and description!

e881c4c500d2c059.text: Cooperate, and I can help soften your sentence!

5c51de8a2c8044c2.text: Percy, be a dear and open the door, will you?

e17d3a53d65ae391.text: What are you going to do about it, Clay?

e21c4f7d5baf1966.text: I mean, let's just assess your situation.

1428a2828412604e.text: You are standing just next to an open helicopter door, defenseless, with a gun pointed at your chest.

48521d44565a0ffd.text: I shot you once. What's to stop me from doing it again?

44ce3c5300f5c68b.text: Not to mention the knife and smoke bomb.

5506263d610b4283.text: Oh really? I stole your pistol from you in the lab, and you didn't notice.

7537f112f81d6f17.text: You may have the chemical formula for the serum, but I still have the sample.

eb7f5573c61678b5.text: Clay, if you turn invisible now, I can just push you out the door.

9b4948ada76fd71b.text: It's not me who's going invisible.

0f1eef41fe8c0689.text: You see, if something is invisible, that must mean that not a single light particle will touch it. So, if I just...

45437afdf172feb4.text: So, if I splash a little into your eyes, you won't be able to see a thi-- no, step away from there!

cb8b900a4329f0a4.text: It appears our man stumbled right out the door.

ef6cdf34ee53218d.text: Completely blinded by the serum, he couldn't see a thing.

349e1ebe01aa6fa8.text: I assumed there would be mild panic, but I never imagined that he would...${outputSpeed = 1000}

2f39f15268eaf470.text: Thank you. I'll take the controls, if you could close the door and sit down over there.

da57b68b85964985.text: Well ${return playerName}, I'm going to return us to the ground, where the authorities are waiting.

161b7748cddd0462.text: ~ The detective is landing ~${startTimer(90000)}

00584e421bf812e0.text: Thank you, Percival. I'm assuming I don't need to use the same persuasive tactics on you?

01732ebff9c2ea5d.text: It looks like this is where we part ways, ${return playerName}.

067d95df2a4dd06c.text: ~ To be continued ~${loopDelay = 2000; outputSpeed = 50}

2dbf1f5133d1aba4.text: It truly has been a pleasure working with you.

539aa9d1a16d2afd.text: If I ever get the chance, I'll request to have you as my partner again.

4db50c0d60006b10.text: You know, for a second there, I really thought I was done for.

75aa8afca5442005.text: ...It's just so crazy to think that that could've been the end of me.

f10ddf8f4f197be1.text: I am glad we were able to catch the criminal, even if we did lose him along the way.

852bbcb46b343bc7.text: Through all my years of detective work, I've rarely been responsible for the death of another man.

39dec22bf404f843.text: That would explain why I never saw anybody, and why I couldn't find any newspapers or photographs.

1ce6cd78efc65b32.text: But then why does the town exist in the first place?

e688e3187f097dae.text: And anyone who came to this town wouldn't see a massive lab, but just a small village hidden away in the countryside.

400688aac317b9eb.text: Maybe everybody was evacuated after Mr. Kane was murdered.

7dd751d04d0dee98.text: Possibly as a cover-up for the professor and his laboratory.

0dda8d3587381598.text: That's what I was thinking, too.

a8eb054529687be4.text: But that wouldn't explain why lights were still turning on and off inside of houses.

bf8d19e08d108d7b.text: Maybe it was a way for the professor to be able to perform his studies alone, without distraction.

9a6eec11b1a426fe.text: Well, no matter. It's over, and I think we can finally consider this case solved.

fa841a1993c67696.text: Oh? Was there something I overlooked?

b92d5abd81f77f5b.text: I think that nobody lives in this town.

296b62f752d99b7c.text: Now I suppose there's nothing left to do but return home.${outputSpeed = 1000}

04470b4862e45f52.text: Very secluded place, Silverborough. Way out in the countryside.

2ce3fdadeea4d5a5.text: In fact, I don't believe I've ever heard of it before now.

d2e9f3f96900a7b8.text: Upon my arrival, I am to meet up with the chief of police, Mr. Douglas Kane.

f7aaa0e4e438e686.text: In any case, I'm almost to the town.

1b146b6dbe0a3c12.text: But I know that whatever it is, I'll get to the bottom of it.

768c6841b24d351c.text: Well ${return playerName}, looks like I'm on my own from here.

c19130a8498f4676.text: Looks like the next leg of the journey will be by boat...${Puzzles[1].load()}

e8eb8982c4b25496.text: Time will still pass, even when the app is closed, so feel free to do something else for a little while and check back in later.

6350af81f3fdfdda.text: Hello! You must be the famous Detective Samuel Clay!${loopDelay = 50}

167e861f04ab19fa.text: I'll help you look, but only for a few minutes and not any longer.${outputSpeed = 750}

69d07d63b48a5843.text: Yes sir. I'll get back to you when something noteworthy happens. this will probably take quite a while, with the lab having so much stuff in it.

04cc68401626ee59.text: How very interesting. It seems we've created an invisibility serum. May I try something?

37d0b877846310b2.text: But in reality, they never existed. You created those stories to throw me off your trail, to get me thinking that we already found the criminal.

189ecab06c9668b5.text: They say the eyes are the window to the soul, and in this case, that statement is quite accurate.

483387fc29e2965e.text: ~ The detective is running ~${startTimer(180000)}

f33d4f85c2134b42.text: I'll run over there now. It shouldn't take me long at all.
